basics.name: Zhixu Duan
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher
basics.summary: Undergraduate at SMEE, UESTC, majoring in Mechanical Engineering (Rank 1/83). Research Assistant at ReliaLab (UESTC) and EPICLab (SJTU). Two-time National Scholarship recipient (Top 1.8%). Passionate about AI4Reliability, zero/few-shot learning, transfer learning, and LLMs. Currently focusing on robust fault diagnosis and industrial code generation.

work.name: EPICLab, SAI of SJTU
work.summary: Advised by Prof. Linfeng Zhang. Focusing on efficient and precision intelligent computing.

work.name: ReliaLab, UESTC
work.company: University of Electronic Science and Technology of China
work.summary: Advised by Prof. Zuoyi Chen and Prof. Hong-Zhong Huang. Researching AI for Reliability and Safety.

education.institution: University of Electronic Science and Technology of China (UESTC)

awards.title: Academic Ranking 1/83
awards.summary: Ranked 1st in the major of Mechanical Engineering.

publications.name: Pseudo-fault data enhanced relation network for fault detection and localization in train transmission systems
publications.publisher: Engineering Applications of Artificial Intelligence (EAAI, SCI Q1)
publications.summary: First author. A relation network using pseudo-fault data improves train transmission fault detection and localization performance.

publications.name: Parallel Relation Network for Intelligent Fault Detection and Localization of Train Transmission Systems with Zero-fault Sample
publications.summary: First author. Oral presentation. A PRN model combining RSN and KAN is proposed for train transmission fault detection with few samples, achieving over 98% accuracy.

publications.name: IndustryCode: A Benchmark for Industry Code Generation
publications.summary: Contributor. A Benchmark for LLM to carry Industry Code Generation.

publications.name: Decoupling Intrinsic Fault Features from Domain Variations via Domain-Attribute Fusion for Unseen-Domain Fault Diagnosis
publications.publisher: Submitted to Mechanical Systems and Signal Processing (MSSP, SCI Q1)
publications.summary: First author. Under Review. A domain-attribute fusion model decouples intrinsic fault features, improving unseen-domain diagnosis robustness.

publications.name: Unified Health Domain Relation Learning for Train Transmission Systems Fault Detection under Complex Operating Conditions
publications.publisher: Submitted to IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics (IEEE TII, SCI Q1)
publications.summary: Co-first Author (first author of adviser). Under Review. A unified health-domain relation learning approach enhances fault detection under complex operating conditions.

publications.name: Open-Set Fault Diagnosis Using CLIP with Forward-Reverse Reasoning
publications.publisher: Submitted to Computers in Industry (COMPUT IND, SCI Q1)
publications.summary: Second author (first author of adviser). Minor Revision. A CLIP-based forward–reverse reasoning model enable for fault diagnosis.

publications.name: Collaborative Teacher-Student Learning: Simulated Domain Attacks for Class-Intrinsic Feature Learning in Multi-Domain Generalized Fault Diagnosis
publications.publisher: Submitted to IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics (IEEE TII, SCI Q1)
publications.summary: First author. Under Review. A collaborative teacher-student learning framework enhances multi-domain generalized fault diagnosis.

publications.name: Two Invention Patents
publications.summary: Second author (first author of adviser). Accepted for filing.

presentations.name: Interview: Take Each Step Steadily, and the Distance Will Unfold
presentations.description: Interviewed by SMEE of UESTC. Available at: https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/ADhuZslqoPZVoshV1WONIw

presentations.name: Uni-Lab Developers’ Offline Workshop
presentations.description: Interviewed by DP Technology regarding the collaboration. Available at: https://uestc-ia.github.io/events/uni-lab-news.html

teaching.description: Invited Prof. Dezhong Yao and Prof. Pedro Antonio Valdes Sosa as advisors; built and maintained the association's official website; promoted outreach and research in bioinformatics, bioimaging, bioelectronics, and AI for Life Science.
Mentored freshmen under the guidance of Counselor Keyu Chen.

portfolio.name: National Innovation and Entrepreneurship Program
portfolio.description: Principal Leader of a National-level College Student Project.
